dt: {bc}to lay out, construct, or manage as an engineer
{bc}to contrive or plan out usually with more or less subtle skill and craft

pt: {sc}guide{/sc} {sc}lead{/sc} {sc}steer{/sc} {sc}pilot{/sc} {sc}engineer{/sc} mean to direct in a course or show the way to be followed. {sc}guide{/sc} implies intimate knowledge of the way and of all its difficulties and dangers.
{sc}lead{/sc} implies showing the way and often keeping those that follow under control and in order.
{sc}steer{/sc} implies an ability to keep to a course and stresses the capacity of maneuvering correctly.

pt.t: {it}steered{/it} the ship through a narrow channel

pt: {sc}pilot{/sc} suggests guidance over a dangerous or complicated course.
{sc}engineer{/sc} implies finding ways to avoid or overcome difficulties in achieving an end or carrying out a plan.

pt.t: {it}engineered{/it} his son's election to the governorship

shortdef: to lay out, construct, or manage as an engineer
to contrive or plan out usually with more or less subtle skill and craft

dt: {bc}a member of a military group devoted to {a_link|engineering} work
{bc}a person who is trained in or follows as a profession a branch of engineering
{bc}a person who carries through an enterprise by skillful or artful contrivance
{bc}a person who runs or supervises an {a_link|engine} or an apparatus

et: Middle English {it}engineour{/it}, from Anglo-French, from {it}enginer{/it} to devise, construct, from {it}engin{/it}
shortdef: a member of a military group devoted to engineering work
a designer or builder of engines

dt: {bc}the application of engineering principles, practices, and technologies to the fields of medicine and biology especially in solving problems and improving care (as in the design of medical devices and diagnostic equipment or the creation of biomaterials and pharmaceuticals) {bc}{sx|bioengineering||1}

shortdef: the application of engineering principles, practices, and technologies to the fields of medicine and biology especially in solving problems and improving care (as in the design of medical devices and diagnostic equipment or the creation of biomaterials and pharmaceuticals) : bioengineering

dt: {bc}engineering dealing with the industrial application of chemistry

shortdef: engineering dealing with the industrial application of chemistry

dt: {bc}an engineer whose training or occupation is in the design and construction especially of public works (such as roads or harbors)

shortdef: an engineer whose training or occupation is in the design and construction especially of public works (such as roads or harbors)

dt: {bc}a flight crewman responsible for mechanical operation

shortdef: a flight crewman responsible for mechanical operation

dt: {bc}engineering that deals with the design, improvement, and installation of integrated systems (as of people, materials, and energy) in industry

shortdef: engineering that deals with the design, improvement, and installation of integrated systems (as of people, materials, and energy) in industry

dt: {bc}a branch of engineering concerned primarily with the industrial application of mechanics and with the production of tools, machinery, and their products

shortdef: a branch of engineering concerned primarily with the industrial application of mechanics and with the production of tools, machinery, and their products

dt: {bc}to disassemble and examine or analyze in detail (a product or device) to discover the concepts involved in manufacture usually in order to produce something similar

shortdef: to disassemble and examine or analyze in detail (a product or device) to discover the concepts involved in manufacture usually in order to produce something similar

dt: {bc}management of human beings in accordance with their place and function in society {bc}applied social science
{bc}social methods (such as {d_link|phishing|phishing}) that are used to obtain personal or confidential information which can then be used illicitly

dt.t: The previously noted trend of switching from {wi}social engineering{/wi} to hacking methods in attacks on organizations strengthened …

shortdef: management of human beings in accordance with their place and function in society : applied social science
social methods (such as phishing) that are used to obtain personal or confidential information which can then be used illicitly
